title: Check for a Balanced Equation
text: Check if the equation is balanced or not. If not, balance the equation.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of $$\operatorname{Mg}\left(OH\right) _2$$
text: Use the equation $$\text{Moles of Reactant A} = \text{Mass of Reactant A} \times \frac{\text{Moles of Reactant A}}{\text{Molar Mass of Reactant A}}$$.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of $$\operatorname{Mg}\left(OH\right) _2$$
text: What is $$16 \text{ g } \text{Mg(OH)}_2 \times \frac{1 \text{ mol } \text{Mg(OH)}_2}{58.3 \text{ g } \text{Mg(OH)}_2}$$? Keep three decimal places.

title: Identify the Stoichiometric Factor
text: The stoichiometric factor relating the two substances of interest is $$\frac{2 \text{ mol NaOH}}{1 \text{ mol } \text{Mg(OH)}_2}$$.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of NaOH
text: The molar amount of NaOH is derived by multiplying the provided molar amount of $$\text{Mg(OH)}_2$$ by the stoichiometric factor.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of NaOH
text: What is $$0.274 \text{ mol } \text{Mg(OH)}_2 \times \frac{2 \text{ mol NaOH}}{1 \text{ mol } \text{Mg(OH)}_2}$$? Keep three decimal places.

title: Calculate the Mass of NaOH
text: Calculate the Mass of NaOH with $$\text{Mass of Reactant A} = \left(\frac{\text{Molar Mass of Reactant A}}{\text{Moles of Reactant A}}\right) \times \text{Moles of Reactant A}$$

title: Calculate the Mass of NaOH
text: What is $$0.548 \text{ mol NaOH} \times \frac{40.0 \text{ g NaOH}}{1 \text{mol NaOH}}$$? Give your answer as an integer.
